10300.name: The Lyceum
10300.description:
You stand inside of the Lyceum, an establishment designed to teach the
basics of play inside this game. Each room has a specific purpose and
contains information on the various commands to maneuver around and
interact with the players. We recommend you explore the Lyceum in full,
taking the time to read the instructions in each room.

Type N to move north to the next room in the Lyceum. If you have already
completed the rigors of the Lyceum and wish to test your combat mettle
in the battlegrounds, type OPEN S or OPEN DOOR, then S to enter the Arena.

exdescs.door: You see a solid oak door.

10301.name: A Stone Corridor
10301.description:
To the west is the language lessons room. Lady Abbigalye is there
to assist you in learning the languages of the land.  To the east
is where Domick will assist you in practicing your weapons, skills
and spells.  When you are finished with your lessons, come back
here and continue north through the Academy.

10302.name: Somewhere
10302.description:
You did it! You are an excellent student! To continue your education,
please leave north. That will return you to the Reading room.

10303.name: The Laboratory of Skills and Spells
10303.description:
This is where you will practice your arsenal of weapons, spells and skills.
Type PRACTICE to get a list of these currently available to you.  Everyone
will have sections listing skills, weapons and languages.  Spells casters
will have an additional section for spells.  To practice a spell, skill or
weapons style, type PRACTICE <full name of spell, skill or weapon style>.

For instance, to practice dispel magic, you would type PRAC DISPEL MAGIC.
When practicing, you start at 0% and one practice will earn you between
15% and 20% proficieny.  Additional knowledge is gained through usage of
the skill or spell until adept, which is a maximum of 30% - 95%.

To get see information using spells, skills or weapons, type HELP CAST or
HELP <spell, skill or weapon style>.  For general questions on practicing,
type HELP PRACTICE.  The number of practice sessions you may gain at each
level is determined by the amount of wisdom you have when you level.

10304.name: The Reading Room
10304.description:
This is a silent room, which means while here you will not see any of the
channels. In fact, you can only use socials, emotes and group tell here.
The room was created to give you a quiet place to read our help files.
You can reduce your own screen scroll by reducing the number of channels
you receive. You can get a full list of channels by typing CHAN. You may
turn off a channel by type CHAN -<channel> and reactive a channel by
typing CHAN +<channel>. For example, you can turn off auction channel by
type CHAN -AUCTION and you can turn it back on by typing CHAN +AUCTION.
You can also turn off ALL your channels by typing CHAN -ALL and turn them
all on again by typing CHAN +ALL. Once you have finished reading, you are
ready to test your ability to negotiate your way around.
Going west will take you into another part of the Academy. The test is to
follow all the room descriptions until you can find your way back to this
point. If at any time you become lost, type U to return to this room. Once
you have successfully returned here, please continue to the north to
explore the rest of the Academy.

10305.name: Chamber of Trials for Rangers
10305.description:
Here you will experience your first full combat against MOBILES, also known
as MOBS. Mobile is the name used for monsters and the like in the game.
All exits, except down, lead to a CAGE mob. Some of these cage mobs may be
aggressive and will attack you upon entering their room. As you kill them,
you will gain experience, as well as academy equipment and gold. Once you
have defeated a mob, type GET ALL CORPSE to loot the coins and equipment.
You may also type CONFIG +AUTOLOOT or CONFIG +AUTOGOLD. Autoloot will take
everything from the corpse when you kill it. Autogold will take only the
gold from the corpse. When you loot a corpse of equipment, the items are
transferred to your inventory. You may suffer injury during the battle, so
return here and type REST or SLEEP. This will speed your healing process.
When you are finished healing, type WAKE or STAND to continue.

10306.name: Abbigayle's Language Lessons
10306.description:
This is where you LEARN your LANGUAGES.  Languages are learned differently
than spells, skills and weapons, as you must be adept ata language before
you may use it.  To see a list of the languages available to you, simply
type PRACTICE.  You do not need to learn the TONGUE of your race nor the
common language, as they both come naturally to you.  To learn a language,
type LANGUAGE LEARN <language type>.

For more information on how to learn a language, type HELP LANGUAGES.  To
learn how to use languages, type HELP SPEAK and HELP TONGUE.  It will cost
a few practice sessions each time you wish to increase your fluency in a
language.  Those who are intelligent, wise and lucky will find it takes
fewer practice sessions to become adept at a language.

10307.name: Wandering the Lyceum
10307.description:
Each player has a menu of items that the game controls automatically once
it has been configured. To get a list of this menu, type CONFIG. For this
part of your schooling, it is suggested you type CONFIG +AUTOEXIT. This
will have the mud show you all obvious exits available to you. When you
are moving around the game, EXIT is a very important command. When you
type EXIT, it shows you the room names each exit shown under obvious exits.
You can use this command to get hints of dangers and death traps that might
be close by. You may also try to LOOK in adjoining rooms. You do this by
typing LOOK <direction>. Your next move is to the west, to see what you
are walking into, try typing EXIT and L W.

exdescs.door: You see a solid oak door.

10308.name: A Dank Pit
10308.description:
Here stands a Chadoyn.  He was captured trying to slaughter the students
of the Academy, and the Immortals decided to spare his life and throw him
in chains for use as a teaching aid.  With him you can practice attacking
and fleeing, but hopefully not dying.  You will also want to make use of
the 'consider' command.  This command compares your level and hitpoints
to that of the creature.  To use here, type 'con chadoyn'.

To use the consider command elsewhere, type CON <MOBNAME>.  It is wise to
ALWAYS consider a mob before fighting it the first time.  This will many
times save your life, as mobs are often a lot more difficult then they
outwardly appear.  Be careful and enjoy your fight.

10309.name: Wandering the Lyceum
10309.description:
This is where you will start learning about exits not listed under "Exits".
Doors are not seen on the game. You must read room description and LOOK
<direction> to find them. Another method of finding a door is to "bump" into
the walls. Type N. OUCH! You ran into the door. You want to be careful not
to be affected with the pass door spell while using the bump method, as you
may end up in a room you would rather not visit. Now, type OPEN N or OPEN
DOOR. Next type EXIT, you will now see the north exit listed under "Exits".
Type HELP OPEN to find out more information on doors.

exdescs.door: You see a solid oak door.

10310.name: An Enclosed Room
10310.description:
You did it! Well done. You will find many rooms such as this all over the
game. Some are easy to find because of hints in the room descriptions.
Some are very hard to find, as the clues could be rooms away. However, you
are now armed with the tools to locate them. You know how to use "look",
bump, and "exit". Many classes also get a spell called "scry". This spell
will allow the person affected by it to see the into the adjoining rooms.
It is used like "look", but gives you more detailed information. To see if
you gain the scry spell at a later level, type SLIST. This will give you a
list of all spells, skills and weapon types you may practice. Slist also
gives you information on what level you may practice each, to what percent
you are currently practiced in each, and what the maximum percent that you
may practice each.

10311.name: Lost in the Lyceum
10311.description:
There are several special exit types that you may encounter in your travels.
You have experienced open exits and closed doors to this point. There are
also hidden doors. The hidden door can not be found with the "bump" method.
Often they will not show up with the "look" method either. These exits are
found by reading room descriptions, mobiles descriptions and looking at
objects. You are looking for words that stand out, those words will be the
door name. You will also find doors that are locked. You may get past some
locked doors with the pass door spell, the pick door skill or bash door skill.
Some doors may only be passed by using the matching key. Other exits you
may find require you to be skilled in climb or affected by the fly spell.
All exits are in real directions that can be abbreviated to the following:
N, E, W, S, NE, NW, SE, SW, U, or D. There are also SOMEWHERE exits that
use "leave", "climb", "enter", or just a word to use. To the north you
will experience a hidden exit, use the room description to find the door name.

10312.name: Lost in the Lyceum
10312.description:
You are standing in a richly decorated room. A large oak table surrounded
by twelve chairs dominates a large portion of the area. Crystal globes with
continual light spells cast on them hover about the room, providing a soft
comfortable light. The walls are adorned with tapestries of the finest
quality. The tapestry on the west wall draws your attention more so than
the others. Now, you have many clues on the possible exit. Try to find the
right word by typing LOOK <word>. For example, try LOOK GLOBES. Sometimes
looking at other things in the rooms description will lead you to the word
that will open the exit.

exdescs.crystal:
This globes cast shadows in the corners. The shadows on the west
tapestry almost appears to be an opening.
exdescs.door: You see a cleverly disguised door.
exdescs.globes:
This globes cast shadows in the corners. The shadows on the west
tapestry almost appears to be an opening.
exdescs.tapestry:
Upon closer inspection you realise that this is not even a tapestry, but
a cunningly camouflaged wall! You can see the outline of a door as you
look closer.
exdescs.w: You see a tapestry on the wall.
exdescs.west: You see a tapestry on the wall here, something just isn't right about it.

10313.name: A Secret Alcove
10313.description:
Well Done! You have found this secret room. Sometimes these secret rooms
will contain valuable items or will lead to other parts of the area you
are exploring. Always pay close attention to room descriptions, mobiles
descriptions and items, this will many times bring profitable results.
This is a where you will experience a Somewhere exit. To find your way
out, try looking at the picture on the wall. If you can not figure it out,
you may leave by the up exit. Good luck!

exdescs.crack: This is a huge CRACK, you could probably squeeze through it.
exdescs.picture:
This is a picture of fresh cut flowers in a glass vase. It seems to
be hanging here just to cover a huge crack. That crack is so large, you
can probably squeeze through it! Perhaps you should look closer at the
crack. HINT: type CRACK.
exdescs.wall:
This is a picture of fresh cut flowers in a glass vase. It seems to
be hanging here just to cover a huge crack. That crack is so large, you
can probably squeeze through it! Perhaps you should look closer at the
crack. HINT: type CRACK.

10314.name: A Marble Corridor
10314.description:
This room will teach you several commands to check your statistics and
character health. These commands are SCORE, EQUIPMENT, INVENTORY, and
LEVEL. Score is used by typing SC, it tells you all the basic statistics
about your character. Equipment is used by typing EQ, this shows you all
the items you are currently wearing. Inventory is used by typing I, and
shows you all items you are carrying other than your worn equipment.
Level is used by typing LEVEL, it show your current level, your current
experience points, and the experience needed for the next few levels.
Use the help menu to get more information on the topics covered here,
type HELP <subject>.

10315.name: Preparing for combat
10315.description:
The time is drawing near to experience combat.  Directly below you now is
the Chadoyn Pit, the home of a creature which will assist you in learning
how to initiate combat.  The Chadoyn is not aggressive, which means you
must begin the fight.  There are many ways to start a fight, the quickest
way is to type KILL <mob>.  As you gain skills and spells, you may find
many of them are also capable of initiating combat.

Some of the more popular spells used to start an attack are DISPEL MAGIC,
SLEEP, CHARM PERSON, BLINDNESS, WEAKEN, CURSE, and FAERIE FIRE.  Some of
the most popular skills used to begin an attack are STEAL and BACKSTAB.
  ** These skills and spells WILL also begin an attack on a player **

Wands, staves and scrolls may also be used to start fights.

10316.name: A Dank Pit
10316.description:
This room explains about WIMPY, FLEE, and RECALL as a way to leave from
combat. Wimpy is an automatic withdrawal from a fight when your hitpoints
reach a set minimum. To set your wimpy, type WIMPY or WIMPY <number>. The
number being the amount of hitpoints you want remaining when you leave the
battle. You will lose experience for wimpying out of a fight, but the amount
of experience lost will generally be less then the amount lost from death.
You may also manually withdraw from a fight with flee. To use flee, just
type FLEE. You may flee out of the fight at any amount of hitpoints. Fleeing
will cost you loss of experience. You may also "recall" from a fight. This
is done with the spell "word of recall" or reciting a recall scroll. You
lose more experience when you recall from a fight then when you use wimpy
or flee. Recall should be used as a last resort.

10317.name: A Marble Corridor
10317.description:
Congratulations! You have come far in your training. Your next step is
getting your equipment from the cage mobs. Northeast of here is the
Academy Spectre, he will cast spells on you to help you with your fights.
Sit with him until you are ready to advance into the cages and proceed
with your training.

10318.name: Hall of the Warrior
10318.description:
You see shields of every make and shape mounted on the walls here. Donated
by the warriors who have passed through these hallowed halls before you. The
clash and ring of steel can be heard coming from the floor beneath you.

10319.name: The Lyceum Healer
10319.description:
This is a healer. You will find many of them throughout the game. Their
purpose is to cast spells of armor, bless, cure blindness, cure poison,
cure light, and refresh. The healer casts these spells randomly to the
characters in the room. Some healers have programs that will allow you
to purchase certain spells for coins. Others have programs that will give
you a spell when you say a certain word or phrase, or do a certain social
to them. It is important to look at mobiles to read their descriptions.
Many will have hints in their descriptions that will tell you what to
say or do to get their favor.

10320.name: Hall of the Druid
10320.description:
Walking along this hall is strangely reminiscent of a stroll through a
lush forest. A light breeze touches your cheek and you look twice to make
sure you are indeed in Darkhaven Academy. You see a soft glow coming from
the floor.

10321.name: Hall of the Vampire
10321.description:
The hall is so dimly lit here that details are hard to discern. The rustle
of dead leaves, blowing in the wind, fills your ears. As you grow to realize
they are more whispers than leaves, you find yourself compelled. Willingly,
you proceed to their source.

10322.name: Hall of the Thief
10322.description:
You have the distinct feeling that you are not the only person here.
Every now and then you catch glimpses of shadows dancing across the wall.
You can feel a slight breeze, as if someone has passed close by you. Upon
searching the area, you confirm you are the only person in sight.

10323.name: Hall of the Mage
10323.description:
The pungent odour of sulphur is dominant here. Fine mists cover the floor,
and a harsh chanting seems to be coming from all around you. Thunder claps
and bursts of light can be seen and heard coming from below you.

10324.name: Hall of the Cleric
10324.description:
A feeling of utter peace and tranquility fills your spirit, ahead you
see the horrors of your nightmares come to life, not giving them a second
glance you pass right through them to fulfill your destiny.

10325.name: Chamber of Trials
10325.description:
Here you will experience your first full combat against MOBILES, also known
as MOBS. Mobile is the name used for monsters and the like in the game.
All exits, except down, lead to a CAGE mob. Some of these cage mobs may be
aggressive and will attack you upon entering their room. As you kill them,
you will gain experience, as well as academy equipment and gold. Once you
have defeated a mob, type GET ALL CORPSE to loot the coins and equipment.
You may also type CONFIG +AUTOLOOT or CONFIG +AUTOGOLD. Autoloot will take
everything from the corpse when you kill it. Autogold will take only the
gold from the corpse. When you loot a corpse of equipment, the items are
transferred to your inventory. You may suffer injury during the battle, so
return here and type REST or SLEEP. This will speed your healing process.
When you are finished healing, type WAKE or STAND to continue.

10326.name: Chamber of Trials for Druids
10326.description:
Here you will experience your first full combat against MOBILES, also known
as MOBS. Mobile is the name used for monsters and the like in the game.
All exits, except down, lead to a CAGE mob. Some of these cage mobs may be
aggressive and will attack you upon entering their room. As you kill them,
you will gain experience, as well as academy equipment and gold. Once you
have defeated a mob, type GET ALL CORPSE to loot the coins and equipment.
You may also type CONFIG +AUTOLOOT or CONFIG +AUTOGOLD. Autoloot will take
everything from the corpse when you kill it. Autogold will take only the
gold from the corpse. When you loot a corpse of equipment, the items are
transferred to your inventory. You may suffer injury during the battle, so
return here and type REST or SLEEP. This will speed your healing process.
When you are finished healing, type WAKE or STAND to continue.

10327.name: Chamber of Trials for Vampires
10327.description:
Here you will experience your first full combat against MOBILES, also known
as MOBS. Mobile is the name used for monsters and the like in the game.
All exits, except down, lead to a CAGE mob. Some of these cage mobs may be
aggressive and will attack you upon entering their room. As you kill them,
you will gain experience, as well as academy equipment and gold. Once you
have defeated a mob, type GET ALL CORPSE to loot the coins and equipment.
You may also type CONFIG +AUTOLOOT or CONFIG +AUTOGOLD. Autoloot will take
everything from the corpse when you kill it. Autogold will take only the
gold from the corpse. When you loot a corpse of equipment, the items are
transferred to your inventory. You may suffer injury during the battle, so
return here and type REST or SLEEP. This will speed your healing process.
When you are finished healing, type WAKE or STAND to continue.

10328.name: Chamber of Trials for Thieves
10328.description:
Here you will experience your first full combat against MOBILES, also known
as MOBS. Mobile is the name used for monsters and the like in the game.
All exits, except down, lead to a CAGE mob. Some of these cage mobs may be
aggressive and will attack you upon entering their room. As you kill them,
you will gain experience, as well as academy equipment and gold. Once you
have defeated a mob, type GET ALL CORPSE to loot the coins and equipment.
You may also type CONFIG +AUTOLOOT or CONFIG +AUTOGOLD. Autoloot will take
everything from the corpse when you kill it. Autogold will take only the
gold from the corpse. When you loot a corpse of equipment, the items are
transferred to your inventory. You may suffer injury during the battle, so
return here and type REST or SLEEP. This will speed your healing process.
When you are finished healing, type WAKE or STAND to continue.

10329.name: Chamber of Trials for Mages
10329.description:
Here you will experience your first full combat against MOBILES, also known
as MOBS. Mobile is the name used for monsters and the like in the game.
All exits, except down, lead to a CAGE mob. Some of these cage mobs may be
aggressive and will attack you upon entering their room. As you kill them,
you will gain experience, as well as academy equipment and gold. Once you
have defeated a mob, type GET ALL CORPSE to loot the coins and equipment.
You may also type CONFIG +AUTOLOOT or CONFIG +AUTOGOLD. Autoloot will take
everything from the corpse when you kill it. Autogold will take only the
gold from the corpse. When you loot a corpse of equipment, the items are
transferred to your inventory. You may suffer injury during the battle, so
return here and type REST or SLEEP. This will speed your healing process.
When you are finished healing, type WAKE or STAND to continue.

10330.name: Chamber of Trials for Clerics
10330.description:
Here you will experience your first full combat against MOBILES, also known
as MOBS. Mobile is the name used for monsters and the like in the game.
All exits, except down, lead to a CAGE mob. Some of these cage mobs may be
aggressive and will attack you upon entering their room. As you kill them,
you will gain experience, as well as academy equipment and gold. Once you
have defeated a mob, type GET ALL CORPSE to loot the coins and equipment.
You may also type CONFIG +AUTOLOOT or CONFIG +AUTOGOLD. Autoloot will take
everything from the corpse when you kill it. Autogold will take only the
gold from the corpse. When you loot a corpse of equipment, the items are
transferred to your inventory. You may suffer injury during the battle, so
return here and type REST or SLEEP. This will speed your healing process.
When you are finished healing, type WAKE or STAND to continue.

10331.name: Clerics West Cage
10331.description:
Kill this "cage" mob, remove the "academy" equipment from the corpse, and
then sacrifice the corpse. Sacrifice is as the name states, you sacrifice
the corpse to the gods and they reward you for it. To use, type SAC CORPSE.
You may also sacrifice unwanted items, by first dropping them on the ground,
then typing SAC <item>. For more information on sacrifice, see the help.

10332.name: Clerics North Cage
10332.description:
As you loot the corpses you will be collecting your equipment, you need to
learn the commands for using your equipment. The commands are: GET, DROP,
WEAR, WIELD, HOLD, REMOVE, REPAIR, and EXAMINE. To get a piece of equipment
from a corpse you type GET <item> CORPSE. To get an item from the ground
you type GET <item>. To drop a piece of equipment from your inventory, type
DROP <item>. To wear an item, type WEAR <item> or WEAR ALL. To wield a
weapon, type WIELD <item>. You may not wield a weapon if you are already
wielding one, you must first remove the weapon you are using. To remove a
weapon or item, type REMOVE <item>. Many pieces of equipment may be damaged
and repaired. To see the condition of a piece of equipment, type EXAM <item>.
If is it in need of repair, you need to find a blacksmith. Once in the room
with the blacksmith, remove item to inventory and type REPAIR <item>.

10333.name: Clerics South Cage
10333.description:
The stench of rotting corpses assaults your senses. Bits of bone and pieces
of rusted armor are strewn about the cage. Remember, kill, loot the corpse,
then sacrifice the corpse. You may type CONFIG +AUTOSAC to have all corpse
sacrificed automatically at the mobiles death. You must use caution when
using autosac as items still inside the corpse are also sacrificed. Even
if you have CONFIG +AUTOLOOT, there are times when your hands are full or
you have reached maximum weight and will be unable to get everything from
the corpse.

10334.name: Clerics East Cage
10334.description:
The cage mobs are all named "cage" in addition to their actual name. This
mob can be killed using KILL CAGE or KILL KOBOLD. All the other cage mobs
are similarly named. The mobs in the battlegrounds will all be referred to
as "arena" in addition to their name. Also, all equipment available in the
Academy is named "academy". You can WEAR ACADEMY or REMOVE ACADEMY in
addition to the actual name of the item.

10335.name: Mages North Cage
10335.description:
As you loot the corpses you will be collecting your equipment, you need to
learn the commands for using your equipment. The commands are: GET, DROP,
WEAR, WIELD, HOLD, REMOVE, REPAIR, and EXAMINE. To get a piece of equipment
from a corpse you type GET <item> CORPSE. To get an item from the ground
you type GET <item>. To drop a piece of equipment from your inventory, type
DROP <item>. To wear an item, type WEAR <item> or WEAR ALL. To wield a
weapon, type WIELD <item>. You may not wield a weapon if you are already
wielding one, you must first remove the weapon you are using. To remove a
weapon or item, type REMOVE <item>. Many pieces of equipment may be damaged
and repaired. To see the condition of a piece of equipment, type EXAM <item>.
If is it in need of repair, you need to find a blacksmith. Once in the room
with the blacksmith, remove item to inventory and type REPAIR <item>.

10336.name: Mages South Cage
10336.description:
The stench of rotting corpses assaults your senses. Bits of bone and pieces
of rusted armor are strewn about the cage. Remember, kill, loot the corpse,
then sacrifice the corpse. You may type CONFIG +AUTOSAC to have all corpse
sacrificed automatically at the mobiles death. You must use caution when
using autosac as items still inside the corpse are also sacrificed. Even
if you have CONFIG +AUTOLOOT, there are times when your hands are full or
you have reached maximum weight and will be unable to get everything from
the corpse.

10337.name: Mages West Room
10337.description:
Kill this "cage" mob, remove the "academy" equipment from the corpse, and
then sacrifice the corpse. Sacrifice is as the name states, you sacrifice
the corpse to the gods and they reward you for it. To use, type SAC CORPSE.
You may also sacrifice unwanted items, by first dropping them on the ground,
then typing SAC <item>. For more information on sacrifice, see the help.

10338.name: Mages East Room
10338.description:
The cage mobs are all named "cage" in addition to their actual name. This
mob can be killed using KILL CAGE or KILL KOBOLD. All the other cage mobs
are similarly named. The mobs in the battlegrounds will all be referred to
as "arena" in addition to their name. Also, all equipment available in the
Academy is named "academy". You can WEAR ACADEMY or REMOVE ACADEMY in
addition to the actual name of the item.

10339.name: North Cage
10339.description:

learn the commands for using your equipment. The commands are: GET, DROP,
WEAR, WIELD, HOLD, REMOVE, REPAIR, and EXAMINE. To get a piece of equipment

If is it in need of repair, you need to find a blacksmith. Once in the room
with the blacksmith, remove item to inventory and type REPAIR <item>.

10340.name: South Cage
10340.description:
The stench of rotting corpses assaults your senses. Bits of bone and pieces

the corpse.

10341.name: West Cage
10341.description:
Kill this "cage" mob, remove the "academy" equipment from the corpse, and
then sacrifice the corpse. Sacrifice is as the name states, you sacrifice

You may also sacrifice unwanted items, by first dropping them on the ground,

10342.name: East Cage
10342.description:
The cage mobs are all named "cage" in addition to their actual name. This

Academy is named "academy". You can WEAR ACADEMY or REMOVE ACADEMY in
addition to the actual name of the item.

10343.name: Druids North Cage
10343.description:
As you loot the corpses you will be collecting your equipment, you need to
learn the commands for using your equipment. The commands are: GET, DROP,
WEAR, WIELD, HOLD, REMOVE, REPAIR, and EXAMINE. To get a piece of equipment
from a corpse you type GET <item> CORPSE. To get an item from the ground
you type GET <item>. To drop a piece of equipment from your inventory, type
DROP <item>. To wear an item, type WEAR <item> or WEAR ALL. To wield a
weapon, type WIELD <item>. You may not wield a weapon if you are already
wielding one, you must first remove the weapon you are using. To remove a
weapon or item, type REMOVE <item>. Many pieces of equipment may be damaged
and repaired. To see the condition of a piece of equipment, type EXAM <item>.
If is it in need of repair, you need to find a blacksmith. Once in the room
with the blacksmith, remove item to inventory and type REPAIR <item>.

10344.name: Druids South Cage
10344.description:
The stench of rotting corpses assaults your senses. Bits of bone and pieces
of rusted armor are strewn about the cage. Remember, kill, loot the corpse,
then sacrifice the corpse. You may type CONFIG +AUTOSAC to have all corpse
sacrificed automatically at the mobiles death. You must use caution when
using autosac as items still inside the corpse are also sacrificed. Even
if you have CONFIG +AUTOLOOT, there are times when your hands are full or
you have reached maximum weight and will be unable to get everything from
the corpse.

10345.name: Druids West Cage
10345.description:
Kill this "cage" mob, remove the "academy" equipment from the corpse, and
then sacrifice the corpse. Sacrifice is as the name states, you sacrifice
the corpse to the gods and they reward you for it. To use, type SAC CORPSE.
You may also sacrifice unwanted items, by first dropping them on the ground,
then typing SAC <item>. For more information on sacrifice, see the help.

10346.name: Druids East Cage
10346.description:
The cage mobs are all named "cage" in addition to their actual name. This
mob can be killed using KILL CAGE or KILL KOBOLD. All the other cage mobs
are similarly named. The mobs in the battlegrounds will all be referred to
as "arena" in addition to their name. Also, all equipment available in the
Academy is named "academy". You can WEAR ACADEMY or REMOVE ACADEMY in
addition to the actual name of the item.

10347.name: Vampires North Cage
10347.description:
As you loot the corpses you will be collecting your equipment, you need to
learn the commands for using your equipment. The commands are: GET, DROP,
WEAR, WIELD, HOLD, REMOVE, REPAIR, and EXAMINE. To get a piece of equipment
from a corpse you type GET <item> CORPSE. To get an item from the ground
you type GET <item>. To drop a piece of equipment from your inventory, type
DROP <item>. To wear an item, type WEAR <item> or WEAR ALL. To wield a
weapon, type WIELD <item>. You may not wield a weapon if you are already
wielding one, you must first remove the weapon you are using. To remove a
weapon or item, type REMOVE <item>. Many pieces of equipment may be damaged
and repaired. To see the condition of a piece of equipment, type EXAM <item>.
If is it in need of repair, you need to find a blacksmith. Once in the room
with the blacksmith, remove item to inventory and type REPAIR <item>.

10348.name: Vampires South Cage
10348.description:
The stench of rotting corpses assaults your senses. Bits of bone and pieces
of rusted armor are strewn about the cage. Remember, kill, loot the corpse,
then sacrifice the corpse. You may type CONFIG +AUTOSAC to have all corpse
sacrificed automatically at the mobiles death. You must use caution when
using autosac as items still inside the corpse are also sacrificed. Even
if you have CONFIG +AUTOLOOT, there are times when your hands are full or
you have reached maximum weight and will be unable to get everything from
the corpse.

10349.name: Vampires West Cage
10349.description:
Kill this "cage" mob, remove the "academy" equipment from the corpse, and
then sacrifice the corpse. Sacrifice is as the name states, you sacrifice
the corpse to the gods and they reward you for it. To use, type SAC CORPSE.
You may also sacrifice unwanted items, by first dropping them on the ground,
then typing SAC <item>. For more information on sacrifice, see the help.

10350.name: Vampires East Cage
10350.description:
The cage mobs are all named "cage" in addition to their actual name. This
mob can be killed using KILL CAGE or KILL KOBOLD. All the other cage mobs
are similarly named. The mobs in the battlegrounds will all be referred to
as "arena" in addition to their name. Also, all equipment available in the
Academy is named "academy". You can WEAR ACADEMY or REMOVE ACADEMY in
addition to the actual name of the item.

10351.name: Thieves North Cage
10351.description:
As you loot the corpses you will be collecting your equipment, you need to
learn the commands for using your equipment. The commands are: GET, DROP,
WEAR, WIELD, HOLD, REMOVE, REPAIR, and EXAMINE. To get a piece of equipment
from a corpse you type GET <item> CORPSE. To get an item from the ground
you type GET <item>. To drop a piece of equipment from your inventory, type
DROP <item>. To wear an item, type WEAR <item> or WEAR ALL. To wield a
weapon, type WIELD <item>. You may not wield a weapon if you are already
wielding one, you must first remove the weapon you are using. To remove a
and repaired. To see the condition of a piece of equipment, type EXAM <item>.
If is it in need of repair, you need to find a blacksmith. Once in the room
with the blacksmith, remove item to inventory and type REPAIR <item>.

10352.name: Thieves South Cage
10352.description:
The stench of rotting corpses assaults your senses. Bits of bone and pieces
of rusted armor are strewn about the cage. Remember, kill, loot the corpse,
then sacrifice the corpse. You may type CONFIG +AUTOSAC to have all corpse
sacrificed automatically at the mobiles death. You must use caution when
using autosac as items still inside the corpse are also sacrificed. Even
if you have CONFIG +AUTOLOOT, there are times when your hands are full or
you have reached maximum weight and will be unable to get everything from
the corpse.

10353.name: Thieves West Cage
10353.description:
Kill this "cage" mob, remove the "academy" equipment from the corpse, and
then sacrifice the corpse. Sacrifice is as the name states, you sacrifice
the corpse to the gods and they reward you for it. To use, type SAC CORPSE.
You may also sacrifice unwanted items, by first dropping them on the ground,
then typing SAC <item>. For more information on sacrifice, see the help.

10354.name: Thieves East Cage
10354.description:
The cage mobs are all named "cage" in addition to their actual name. This
mob can be killed using KILL CAGE or KILL KOBOLD. All the other cage mobs
are similarly named. The mobs in the battlegrounds will all be referred to
as "arena" in addition to their name. Also, all equipment available in the
Academy is named "academy". You can WEAR ACADEMY or REMOVE ACADEMY in
addition to the actual name of the item.

10355.name: The Room of Portals
10355.description:
This is the portal room which leads to the training hall for each of the
classes.  Prepare to be transferred once your presence is noticed.  It may
take a few moments, so please be patient.  Should you decide you are not
ready to face the Chamber of Trials, you can return to the south.  You
notice a large certificate on the wall; at least you have something
to read while you wait.

exdescs.certificate:
I have enjoyed writing the revision of the Darkhaven Academy. I wanted
the new players armed with as much information as possible before venturing
into the open game. Take your time here, learning the commands and seeing
how the programs on the mobs and items work. It will help you later in your
travels. If you have trouble understanding anything you find in the Academy,
type WHO 51 and ask an immortal for assistance. I wish you well in your
adventuring. May you enjoy many hours of joy and develop many friendships.

                     Warm Huggles,
                     Brittany Seccunda-DethBlayde
                     February 9, 1996

** Please be sure to read HELP RULES STAKE prior to engaging in fighting.
** Staking a mob is illegal, as is stealing a kill.
exdescs.wall:
I have enjoyed writing the revision of the Darkhaven Academy. I wanted
the new players armed with as much information as possible before venturing
into the open game. Take your time here, learning the commands and seeing
how the programs on the mobs and items work. It will help you later in your
travels. If you have trouble understanding anything you find in the Academy,
type WHO 51 and ask an immortal for assistance. I wish you well in your
adventuring. May you enjoy many hours of joy and develop many friendships.

                     Warm Huggles,
                     Brittany Seccunda-DethBlayde
                     February 9, 1996

** Please be sure to read HELP RULES STAKE prior to engaging in fighting.
** Staking a mob is illegal, as is stealing a kill.

10356.name: A Stone Corridor
10356.description:
This is the stage of your training where you may begin to feel pangs of
hunger and a parched throat. In other words, you need food and drink. To
the east is the Lyceum Supply Store. You may purchase water and some meat.
Once you have eaten and drunk, you will be ready to proceed north.

10357.name: Lyceum Supply Store
10357.description:
This is a regular shop, you type LIST to see what you can purchase and
BUY <item> to make the purchase. Like many other places in the game,
you may bribe the storekeeper to give you an item. There are many mobs
in this world that will sell you keys, items or information in exchange
for a few gold coins. Be sure to look at the mobiles for hints on these
types of programs.

10358.name: A Stone Corridor
10358.description:
In this part of the academy you will learn about the Death Trap, more
commonly known as a DT. A death trap is exactly as its name states, a
room that causes your death. Unlike a regular death, you do not lose
your hitpoints and you do not leave a corpse behind. All the items you
were wearing and carrying are destroyed. You do not leave a corpse behind.
You are then transported back to the Temple in Darkhaven. Going west will
give you more information about death traps.

10359.name: Slow Death
10359.description:
This is what you will see if you stumble into a death trap.  As previously
stated, a DT kills instantaneously and destroys any and all equipment you
have at the time.  Hints as to the placement of a death trap are sometimes
given in the room that preceeds them.  Also remember to use "exit" and
"look" to find these deadly rooms.  Note:  no DTS are found in Darkhaven.

10360.name: A Stone Corridor
10360.description:
One final challenge remains for you. Then you may enter the battlegrounds
to further hone your combat skills. To the west is a creature that holds
the visor of completion. Kill him and it is yours.

10361.name: A Final Test
10361.description:
You can hear the clash of steel and chanting coming from somewhere above
you. This room smells of decay. The walls are dripping with some sort of
green ichor. It looks as if it is burning right through. You see a flash
of light from the above, then it is gone.

10362.name: In the middle of the eastern wall
10362.description:
This is the Academy entrance to the Battleground. Below here is the lower
level of the Academy. The battleground were supplied to allow you to further
hone the combat skills learned in your schooling. Kill the beasts that wander
here. If you wish to leave, exiting up will take you to Lord Toric.

10363.name: Along the eastern wall
10363.description:
You hear the howl of some unnatural beast echo off the walls. The ground
is stained with dried blood, looking closer you see tracks of some sort
of creature ... but what?

10364.name: North-East Corner
10364.description:
This area will allow you to further hone your combat skills. Kill the beasts
that wander here. If you wish to leave, exiting up will take you to the room
for Toric, the Lord of Healing, in the Darkhaven Academy.

10365.name: Along the eastern wall
10365.description:
You hear the howl of some unnatural beast echo off the walls. The ground
is stained with dried blood, looking closer you see tracks of some sort
of creature ... but what?

10366.name: South-East Corner
10366.description:
This area will allow you to further hone your combat skills. Kill the beasts
that wander here. If you wish to leave, exiting up will take you to the room
for Toric, the Lord of Healing, in the Darkhaven Academy.

10367.name: Along the southern wall
10367.description:
You hear the howl of some unnatural beast echo off the walls. The ground
is stained with dried blood, looking closer you see tracks of some sort
of creature ... but what?

10368.name: Battle Grounds
10368.description:
This area will allow you to further hone your combat skills. Kill the beasts
that wander here. If you wish to leave, exiting up will take you to the room
for Toric, the Lord of Healing, in the Darkhaven Academy.

10369.name: Mid-way in the Battlegrounds
10369.description:
You hear the howl of some unnatural beast echo off the walls. The ground
is stained with dried blood, looking closer you see tracks of some sort
of creature ... but what?

10370.name: Battle Grounds
10370.description:
This area will allow you to further hone your combat skills. Kill the beasts
that wander here. If you wish to leave, exiting up will take you to the room
for Toric, the Lord of Healing, in the Darkhaven Academy.

10371.name: Along the northern wall
10371.description:
You hear the howl of some unnatural beast echo off the walls. The ground
is stained with dried blood, looking closer you see tracks of some sort
of creature ... but what?

10372.name: In the middle of the northern wall
10372.description:
This area will allow you to further hone your combat skills. Kill the beasts
that wander here. If you wish to leave, exiting up will take you to the room
for Toric, the Lord of Healing, in the Darkhaven Academy.

10373.name: Central Battlegrounds
10373.description:
You hear the howl of some unnatural beast echo off the walls. The ground
is stained with dried blood, looking closer you see tracks of some sort
of creature ... but what?  You can hear a load wail of pain coming from
somewhere below!  Yet another sound catches your attention, as someone
succumbs to death.

10374.name: The Center of the Battlegrounds
10374.description:
This area will allow you to further hone your combat skills. Kill the beasts
that wander here. If you wish to leave, exiting up will take you to the room
for Toric, the Lord of Healing, in the Darkhaven Academy.

10375.name: Central Battlegrounds
10375.description:
You hear the howl of some unnatural beast echo off the walls. The ground
is stained with dried blood, looking closer you see tracks of some sort
of creature ... but what?

10376.name: In the middle of the southern wall
10376.description:
This area will allow you to further hone your combat skills. Kill the beasts
that wander here. If you wish to leave, exiting up will take you to the room
for Toric, the Lord of Healing, in the Darkhaven Academy.

10377.name: Along the southern wall
10377.description:
You hear the howl of some unnatural beast echo off the walls. The ground
is stained with dried blood, looking closer you see tracks of some sort
of creature ... but what?

10378.name: Battle Grounds
10378.description:
This area will allow you to further hone your combat skills. Kill the beasts
that wander here. If you wish to leave, exiting up will take you to the room
for Toric, the Lord of Healing, in the Darkhaven Academy.

10379.name: Mid-way in the Battlegrounds
10379.description:
You hear the howl of some unnatural beast echo off the walls. The ground
is stained with dried blood, looking closer you see tracks of some sort
of creature ... but what?

10380.name: Battle Grounds
10380.description:
This area will allow you to further hone your combat skills. Kill the beasts
that wander here. If you wish to leave, exiting up will take you to the room
for Toric, the Lord of Healing, in the Darkhaven Academy.

10381.name: Along the northern wall
10381.description:
You hear the howl of some unnatural beast echo off the walls. The ground
is stained with dried blood, looking closer you see tracks of some sort
of creature ... but what?

10382.name: North-West Corner
10382.description:
This area will allow you to further hone your combat skills. Kill the beasts
that wander here. If you wish to leave, exiting up will take you to the room
for Toric, the Lord of Healing, in the Lyceum.

10383.name: Along the western wall
10383.description:
You hear the howl of some unnatural beast echo off the walls. The ground
is stained with dried blood, looking closer you see tracks of some sort
of creature ... but what?

10384.name: In the middle of the western wall
10384.description:
This area will allow you to further hone your combat skills. Kill the beasts
that wander here. If you wish to leave, exiting up will take you to the room
for Toric, the Lord of Healing, in the Darkhaven Academy.

10385.name: Along the western wall
10385.description:
You hear the howl of some unnatural beast echo off the walls. The ground
is stained with dried blood, looking closer you see tracks of some sort
of creature ... but what?

10386.name: South-West Corner
10386.description:
This area will allow you to further hone your combat skills. Kill the beasts
that wander here. If you wish to leave, exiting up will take you to the room
for Toric, the Lord of Healing, in the Darkhaven Academy. You see some strange
symbols glowing in the ground here.  They look like RUNES.

exdescs.runes:
Going down into this hole will take you to the domain of the Naga. Be careful
they are aggressive, proceed at your own risk!.

10387.name: Rangers South Cage
10387.description:
The stench of rotting corpses assaults your senses. Bits of bone and pieces
of rusted armor are strewn about the cage. Remember, kill, loot the corpse,
then sacrifice the corpse. You may type CONFIG +AUTOSAC to have all corpse
sacrificed automatically at the mobiles death. You must use caution when
using autosac as items still inside the corpse are also sacrificed. Even
if you have CONFIG +AUTOLOOT, there are times when your hands are full or
you have reached maximum weight and will be unable to get everything from
the corpse.

10388.name: Rangers East Cage
10388.description:
The cage mobs are all named "cage" in addition to their actual name. This
mob can be killed using KILL CAGE or KILL KOBOLD. All the other cage mobs
are similarly named. The mobs in the battlegrounds will all be referred to
as "arena" in addition to their name. Also, all equipment available in the
Academy is named "academy". You can WEAR ACADEMY or REMOVE ACADEMY in
addition to the actual name of the item.

10389.name: Rangers North Cage
10389.description:
As you loot the corpses you will be collecting your equipment, you need to
learn the commands for using your equipment. The commands are: GET, DROP,
WEAR, WIELD, HOLD, REMOVE, REPAIR, and EXAMINE. To get a piece of equipment
from a corpse you type GET <item> CORPSE. To get an item from the ground
you type GET <item>. To drop a piece of equipment from your inventory, type
DROP <item>. To wear an item, type WEAR <item> or WEAR ALL. To wield a
weapon, type WIELD <item>. You may not wield a weapon if you are already
wielding one, you must first remove the weapon you are using. To remove a
weapon or item, type REMOVE <item>. Many pieces of equipment may be damaged
and repaired. To see the condition of a piece of equipment, type EXAM <item>.
If is it in need of repair, you need to find a blacksmith. Once in the room
with the blacksmith, remove item to inventory and type REPAIR <item>.

10390.name: Rangers West Cage
10390.description:
Kill this "cage" mob, remove the "academy" equipment from the corpse, and
then sacrifice the corpse. Sacrifice is as the name states, you sacrifice
the corpse to the gods and they reward you for it. To use, type SAC CORPSE.
You may also sacrifice unwanted items, by first dropping them on the ground,
then typing SAC <item>. For more information on sacrifice, see the help.

10391.name: Hall of the Ranger
10391.description:
The freedom of the wild, always has it fascinated you. To be free in the
land, independent of cities and civilizations. These thoughts flood your
mind as you walk this hallway.

10392.name: In a Humid Cavern.
10392.description:
You are standing in an underground cavern, moss is prevalent along the ceiling
and walls. A steady dripping is echoing through the area and seems to be coming
from everywhere.

10393.name: In the Cavern
10393.description:
The steady sound of hissing can be heard in the distance.  The air here
is extremely humid, you are finding it very difficult to breathe.

10394.name: In the Cavern
10394.description:
You feel as if you are being pulled into the mire, the constant dampness
of the cavern has caused the ground to be turned into a mud bog.

10395.name: Deeper in the Cavern
10395.description:
The steady sound of hissing can be heard in the distance, closer actually
than you would like. The air here is humid and breathing is difficult.

10396.name: In the Cavern
10396.description:
You feel you are being pulled into the mire, the constant dampness and
humidity have caused the ground to be transformed into a mud bog.

10397.name: Cove of the Queen
10397.description:
You have inadvertently stumbled upon the cove of the Queen of the Nagas.
This room is littered with bloated corpses of adventurers who have been
reported lost in the past few days.

10398.name: DELETE THIS ROOM
10398.description:
This room is for questions and problems you may find as a new player.
All level of players are welcome to post questions/suggestions here.
If you are between level 1 and level 10, you may receive a piece of
note paper and a quill to write with by typing:    NOD

If you are above level 10 and wish to post here, you can buy note paper
in Darkhaven. Please type HELP NOTE to learn how to write a note. There
is no use of profanity on this or any note board.

**--**     Any note posted here may be removed at any time.     **--**

10399.name: Blazing Chamber
10399.description:
This chamber is covered with runes of warding and power a ball of scrying
hovers in front of Scarab's throne. The throne is made from the bones of
his mortal self before he passed onto the realm of immortality. Looking
you discover a t.v. and vcr behind the throne for use when the Realms are
not in need of the Lord of Dark Magic.

10400.name: Hall of the Augurer
10400.description:
This chamber is filled with an aura of utter calmness and peace.  The
walls are painted a soft hue, adding to the affect.  Here is were the
Augurers come to meditate and reflect upon their activities of the
day.  Small, spartan cots line the walls, each well-padded to make a
comfortable resting place for an exhausted adventurer.

exdescs.cots: Several cots line each wall. They look like they are very comfortable.
exdescs.walls: The walls are painted a soft blue, adding a calm feeling to the place.

10401.name: Chamber of Trials for Augurers
10401.description:
Here you will experience your first full combat against MOBILES, also known
as MOBS. Mobile is the name used for monsters and the like in the game.
All exits, except down, lead to a CAGE mob. Some of these cage mobs may be
aggressive and will attack you upon entering their room. As you kill them,
you will gain experience, as well as academy equipment and gold. Once you
have defeated a mob, type GET ALL CORPSE to loot the coins and equipment.
You may also type CONFIG +AUTOLOOT or CONFIG +AUTOGOLD. Autoloot will take
everything from the corpse when you kill it. Autogold will take only the
gold from the corpse. When you loot a corpse of equipment, the items are
transferred to your inventory. You may suffer injury during the battle, so
return here and type REST or SLEEP. This will speed your healing process.
When you are finished healing, type WAKE or STAND to continue.

10402.name: Augurers North Cage
10402.description:
As you loot the corpses you will collect basic Academy equipment.  The
commands for using your new belongings are:  GET, DROP, WEAR, WIELD, HOLD,
REMOVE, REPAIR, and EXAMINE.  "Get <item>" or "get <item> corpse" takes an
object from the ground or from a corpse and places it into your inventory.
To wear an item from your inventory type "wear item", and to remove it and
return it to your inventory type "remove <item>".  To drop an item in your
inventory, type "drop <item>".  To wield a weapon, type "wield <weapon>".
Many items may be damaged and repaired.  To see an item's condition, type
"exam <item>".  To repair an item type "repair <item>" at a blacksmith.

10403.name: Augurers East Cage
10403.description:
Kill this "cage" mob, remove the "academy" equipment from its corpse, and
then sacrifice the corpse.  Sacrifice is as the name states, you sacrifice
the corpse to the gods and they reward you for it (albeit minorly).  To use,
type 'sac corpse'.  You may also sacrifice unwanted items by first dropping
them and then typing 'sac <item>'.  See 'help sacrifice' for information.

10404.name: Augurers South Cage
10404.description:
The stench of rotting corpses assaults your nostrils, while bits of bone
and pieces of rusted armor are strewn about the cage.  Remember - kill,
loot the corpse, then sacrifice the corpse.  You may type 'config +autosac'
to have all corpse sacrificed automatically when you kill the creature.
You must use caution when using autosac, as items still inside the corpse
are also sacrificed.  Even if you have 'config +autloot', there are times
when your hands are full or you have reached maximum weight and will be
unable to get everything from the corpse automatically.

10405.name: Augurers West Cage
10405.description:
The cage mobs are all named "cage" in addition to their actual name, thus
these creatures can be killed using 'kill cage' or 'kill kobold'.  All the
other cage mobs are similarly named.  The mobs in the battlegrounds will all
be referred to as "arena" in addition to their name.  Also, all equipment
available in the Academy is named "academy".  You can 'wear academy' or
'remove academy' in addition to the actual name of the item.

10406.name: A dark tunnel below the Battlegrounds
10406.description:
You have left the relative saftey of the battlegrounds above.  A thick
stench of death, moisture, and heat mix to assault your every breath.
The walls of this tunnel are covered with a slimy layer of a liquid
similar to sweat.  Below your feet, the ground seems to sink slightly,
barely handling your weight.  Crudely carved tunnels lead deeper into
this underground chamber to the southwest and southeast.

10407.name: A dark tunnel below the Battlegrounds
10407.description:
The walls of this tunnel are close, barely allowing you passage.
The earth under your feet is damp and sticking to your boots.  A
squeal can be heard coming from the south.  You may want to return
back to the safety of the Battlegrounds.

10408.name: A dark tunnel below the Battlegrounds
10408.description:
Darkness engulfs this tunnel, making it impossible to see without a
light source.  Water drips slowly down the tunnel walls, adding to
the moisture in the soil and humidity in the air.  This place does
appear to be very welcoming.

10409.name: A dark tunnel below the Battlegrounds
10409.description:
The walls of this tunnel are close, barely allowing you passage.
The earth under your feet is damp and sticking to your boots.  A
squeal can be heard coming from the south.  You may want to return
back to the safety of the Battlegrounds far towards the north.

10410.name: A dark tunnel below the Battlegrounds
10410.description:
Darkness engulfs this tunnel, making it impossible to see without a
light source.  Water drips slowly down the tunnel walls, adding to
the moisture in the soil and humidity in the air.  This place does
appear to be very welcoming.

10411.name: A dark tunnel below the Battlegrounds
10411.description:
You have entered a opening in the rock, and can see a large cavern
to the east.  Sounds echo around you, coming from everywhere and
nowhere. This place gives you a sick feeling in the pit of your
stomach.

10412.name: A dark tunnel below the Battlegrounds
10412.description:
The tunnel stops abruptly at the southern wall.  There are several
openings leading away from the tunnel, into a large cavern.  You can
hear a lot of noise in the area, and none of it sounds pleasant.

10413.name: A hollow cavern deep underground
10413.description:
Booming echoes overwhelm your senses.  Loud dripping, sounding like
many large hammers crashing against the stone walls, assault your every
moment. Cries of death surround and torment you.  You get a distinct
urge to move away from here as quickly, and unnoticed, as possible.

10414.name: A hollow cavern deep underground
10414.description:
The sounds seem to coalesces here, making one noise indistinguishable
from the next.  The cavern wall to the south seems to be sweating,
drips of water roll down its face, collecting in a puddle at your feet.
You have a desire to leave this place, and venture somewhere less
deafening.

10415.name: A hollow cavern deep underground
10415.description:
Booming echoes overwhelm your senses.  Loud dripping, sounding like
many large hammers crashing against the stone walls, assault your every
moment. Cries of death surround and torment you.  You get a distinct
urge to move away from here as quickly, and unnoticed, as possible.

10416.name: A hollow cavern deep underground
10416.description:
You sink a few inches into the mud that makes up the floor of this
cavern. Darkness and noise punctuate the devestating nothingness
that fills this space.  If there is life to be found in this place,
you are sure you do not want to run across it.

10417.name: A hollow cavern deep underground
10417.description:
As you wander through the muggy darkness, your nose detects the musty
scents of fungus and decay as your passing stirs the still air.  The
sounds of battle echo around you as you continue your journey through
the gloom, loud enough to make you believe that around the next
corner you may find two combatents struggling for life. You continue
onwards through the gloom, your senses screaming for you to flee before
it's too late.

10418.name: A hollow cavern deep underground
10418.description:
Hollow and barren of color and light, this place is overwhelming with
sounds and moisture.  The sound of water dripping and wails of pain and
death can be heard all around you.  Whatever resides in this awful place
does not welcome strangers.

10419.name: A dark tunnel below the Battlegrounds
10419.description:
The tunnel stops abruptly at the southern wall.  There are several
openings leading away from the tunnel, into a large cavern.  You can
hear a lot of noise in the area, and none of it sounds pleasant.

10420.name: A hollow cavern deep underground
10420.description:
Hollow and barren of color and light, this place is overwhelming with
sounds and moisture.  The sound of water dripping and wails of pain and
death can be heard all around you.  Whatever resides in this awful place
does not welcome strangers.

10421.name: A hollow cavern deep underground
10421.description:
To the north is a craggy rock wall of the cavern, covered in a slimy
film of an unknown source.  From all directions you are assaulted by
howls of pain, and cries of death.  Moisture clings to your skin,
making you feel much hotter then you should for the air temperature.

10422.name: A hollow cavern deep underground
10422.description:
You sink a few inches into the mud that makes up the floor of this
cavern. Darkness and noise punctuate the devestating nothingness
that fills this space.  If there is life to be found in this place,
you are sure you do not want to run across it.

10423.name: A dark tunnel below the Battlegrounds
10423.description:
You have entered a opening in the rock, and can see a large cavern
to the west.  Sounds echo around you, coming from everywhere and
nowhere. This place gives you a sick feeling in the pit of your
stomach.

10424.name: A dark tunnel below the Battlegrounds
10424.description:
Darkness engulfs this tunnel, making it impossible to see without a
light source.  Water drips slowly down the tunnel walls, adding to
the moisture in the soil and humidity in the air.  This place does
appear to be very welcoming.

10425.name: A dark tunnel below the Battlegrounds
10425.description:
The walls of this tunnel are close, barely allowing you passage.
The earth under your feet is damp and sticking to your boots.  A
squeal can be heard coming from the south.  You may want to return
back to the safety of the Battlegrounds far towards the north.

10426.name: A dark tunnel below the Battlegrounds
10426.description:
Darkness engulfs this tunnel, making it impossible to see without a
light source.  Water drips slowly down the tunnel walls, adding to
the moisture in the soil and humidity in the air.  This place does
appear to be very welcoming.

10427.name: A dark tunnel below the Battlegrounds
10427.description:
The walls of this tunnel are close, barely allowing you passage.
The earth under your feet is damp and sticking to your boots.  A
squeal can be heard coming from the south.  You may want to return
back to the safety of the Battlegrounds.

10429.name: Tower of Trials Ground Level
10429.description:
The floor is polished marble, with a black and white checker pattern, almost
like a giant chess board. A set of stairs in the center of the room spirals
upward to the next floor. A single stout wooden set of double doors allows
entry in and out of the tower through the southern wall.

10430.name: Tower of Trials Second Floor
10430.description:
The floor is polished marble, with a black and white checker
pattern, almost like a giant chess board. A set of stairs in
the center of the room spirals upward to the third floor and
downward to the ground floor. The walls appear to be made of
some sort of grey stone that glows slightly.

10431.name: Tower of Trials Third Floor
10431.description:
The floor is polished marble, with a black and white checker
pattern, almost like a giant chess board. A set of stairs in
the center of the room spirals upward to the fourth floor and
downward to second floor. The walls appear to be made of
some sort of grey stone that glows slightly.

10432.name: Tower of Trials Fourth Floor
10432.description:
The floor is polished marble, with a black and white checker
pattern, almost like a giant chess board. A set of stairs in
the center of the room spirals upward to the rooftop and
downward to third floor. The walls appear to be made of
some sort of grey stone that glows slightly.

10433.name: Roof of the Tower of Trials
10433.description:
You stand on the roof at the top of the tower. Above you, stars twinkle
brightly. A vast sea of stars stretches out in all directions below the tower,
making it appear as though the tower floats here in the sky. The top of the
tower is made of the same stone as the interior walls. It glows softly in time
with the twinkling of the stars.

10499.name: Chamber of the Watch
10499.description:
Here reside the watchers of the gateway between the Realms and the
outside world, and from here all new adventurers are observed and
noted by the inhabitants herein.

** This room should *not* be used for any activities of any kind
other than those of the two mobs residing here.  Do not ever move
or purge either of these mobiles if the pre-auth system is used. **
